review_title: Toxic, Unsafe Work Conditions, Illegal Employment Standard
pros: Good work experience for pre-med students, social work students, and other healthcare fields. Detox experience, addictions experience and community health work experience
cons:
Working in homelessness and addictions is not an easy job to begin with, and Alpha House doesn't make it any easier. It's an extremely high-stress job. Chronic lack of staff leaves everyone doing the workload of 2-3 people-every shift. Lack of support from management and administration leaves you very frustrated.

The constant lack of staff in the main building leaves staff members working alone at night in detox, or a minimum of 3 people in shelter. Forcing staff to work in unsafe work conditions, and puts the safety of clients in the building - at risk. Emails sent to management about safety concerns and other issues- fall on deaf ears. There is no support from management even during dangerous, violent, or critical incidents. 

Part-time and casual staff are not allowed to call in sick, they must come in until their shift is covered- which is illegal. As a Team Lead, you cannot call in sick. 

Part-time Team Leads (weekends) work 12 hour shifts Saturdays and Sundays, 3 weeks on Days, and 3 weeks on nights. There is no health benefits for being a PT team lead, despite the fact that the work load and responsibility is the same as Full time (Monday-Friday) team leads. No benefits, no ability to call in sick, no time off, and definitely not worth it. 

Do not work for an agency that violates occupational health and safety regulations, as well as Alberta employment standards.
